User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the SILK AI application.

profilePictureUrl.description: URL of the user's profile picture.

registrationDate.description: Date and time when the user registered.

lastLogin.description: Date and time of the user's last login.

allowAiTraining.description: Indicates whether the user allows their data to be used for AI model training.

ChatSession.title: ChatSession
ChatSession.description: Represents a chat session between a user and the AI.

id.description: Unique identifier for the chat session.

startTime.description: Date and time when the chat session started.

endTime.description: Date and time when the chat session ended.

sessionName.description: Name of this session. Can be user or AI generated.

ChatMessage.title: ChatMessage
ChatMessage.description: Represents a single message within a chat session.

id.description: Unique identifier for the chat message.

sender.description: Indicates who sent the message (user or AI).

messageText.description: The actual text content of the message.

timestamp.description: Date and time when the message was sent.

contentType.description: The type of message (text, image, file).

contentUrl.description: The URL where the content is located.  Applicable for images and files.

definition.description: Stores user profile information. The 'userId' parameter is the Firebase Authentication UID.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique ID of the user, corresponding to their Firebase Authentication UID.

definition.description: Stores chat sessions for a specific user. The 'userId' parameter ensures ownership. Path based ownership: all chat sessions belong to the user with ID `userId`.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique ID of the user who owns the chat session.

params.name: chatSessionId
params.description: The unique ID of the chat session.

definition.description: Stores individual chat messages within a chat session. The 'userId' and 'chatSessionId' parameters ensure proper nesting and ownership.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique ID of the user who owns the chat session.

params.name: chatSessionId
params.description: The unique ID of the chat session.

params.name: chatMessageId
params.description: The unique ID of the chat message.

definition.description: Stores chat sessions for an anonymous user.

params.name: anonymousUserId
params.description: The unique ID of the anonymous user.

params.name: chatSessionId
params.description: The unique ID of the chat session.

definition.description: Stores individual chat messages within a chat session for anonymous users.

params.name: anonymousUserId
params.description: The unique ID of the anonymous user.

params.name: chatSessionId
params.description: The unique ID of the chat session.

params.name: chatMessageId
params.description: The unique ID of the chat message.

firestore.reasoning: This Firestore structure prioritizes authorization independence and QAPs (Query-based Access Patterns). User data is stored under `/users/{userId}`, which is a simple path-based ownership model. Chat sessions and messages are nested under the user, maintaining a clear ownership hierarchy. Denormalization is not strictly needed here as the security rules will rely on the `request.auth.uid` matching the `userId` in the path. AI training preference (`allowAiTraining`) is stored directly within the user document. The anonymous authentication option stores chat data related to not signed in users in a `anonymous_users` collection. Data for anonymous users is stored by their unique auto-generated ID.
